meanings.sent1: The soil was phosphatic, rich in nutrients for plant growth.
meanings.sent2: The scientist analyzed the phosphatic rocks for their mineral content.
meanings.sent3: The phosphatic fertilizer danced happily into the garden soil.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and phosphatic as the full moon.
meanings.sent5: The phosphatic glow of the fireflies lit up the summer night.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or derived from phosphorus
meanings.sent1: The phosphatic compound emitted a faint glow in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The phosphatic element was crucial for the chemical reaction to occur.
meanings.sent3: The phosphatic glow stick was the life of the party.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were as phosphatic and illuminating as a lighthouse beacon.
meanings.sent5: The phosphatic smell of the match being struck filled the room.
